name: mumble
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
B2 to speak quietly and in a way that is not clear so that the words are difficult to understand: She mumbled something about being too busy. [ + speech ] "I'm sorry," he mumbled.
Thesaurus: synonyms, antonyms, and examples
to talk to someonetalkA group of men were talking in the street.speakCould I speak to you privately?sayI couldn't hear what they were saying.chatWe were just chatting about the party.have a chatWe had a little chat over the garden wall.chatterThey spent the morning chattering away.

Add to word list
Add to word list
to speak quietly or in an unclear way so that the words are difficult to understand: [ T ] She mumbled something about needing to be home, then left. [ I ] He often mumbles, and I never know what he’s asking me.
